text:
Jean-Louis Koszul (; January 3, 1921 – January 12, 2018) was a French mathematician. He was born in Strasbourg, France. Koszul was best known for studying geometry and discovering the Koszul complex. From 1980 until his death, Koszul was a member of the French Academy of Sciences.
Koszul died on January 12, 2018 in Paris at the age of 97.
